page.title: 10SECONDARY SCHOOL AS IT WAS.
page.content: Later school life in Devizes at the beginning of the 20th Century,as told by Mr.Ray Smith. From the age of eight to ten,Mr.Smith went to Parnella School.(See Page 9) There were two or three state schools in Devizes, but these were overcrowded. By the Market Place was a very grand school, where you had to pay a lot to attend. At ten, Mr.Smith left Parnella School and went to the Grammar School which was near today's Comprehensive School. Here there were about sixty pupils, twenty of whom were 'boarders' and lived at Heathcote House with the headmaster. The motto of the school was 'Factis non Verbis.' Mr.Smith left school at fourteen and became an apprentice for seven years in a music shop called Handels. {(See also Page 9.)}
